title: useful?
content:
does anybody find this useful:  
a small 5-page »history of typography«  
(in german language) -\>

[http://mediengestalter.designworks.de/pdf/typographie\_evolution.pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20060423033920/http:/mediengestalter.designworks.de/pdf/typographie_evolution.pdf)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [typographie\_evo.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20060423033920/http:/typophile.com/files/typographie_evo.gif) | 11.92 KB |
author: andreas.kuhn

comments.content:
created that for education purposes  
back in 2002. maybe somebody is  
able to translate it to build an  
english version?!

andreas kuhn | electronic publishing  
http://www.designworks.de  
 [a.kuhn@designworks.de](mailto:a.kuhn@designworks.de)

Beautifully designed time line. I like your use of the red. People will argue over the content of the page on the last 100 years. For example, art deco in my opinion should be there. The GIF is too small to read any of the content.
Andreas, could you post a full size version as a downloadable PDF?
